wikipedia_page.main: John Parry (23 March 1812 – 19 January 1874) was a Welsh editor and professor, remembered mainly as chief editor of the Encyclopaedia Cambrensis. He was the son-in-Law of Thomas Gee, the publisher of the encyclopedia.

response: *John Parry (Bardd Alaw) (1776–1851), Welsh harpist and composer, and father of John Orlando Parry
*John Parry (harpist) (c1710–1782), celebrated blind harpist from Wales
*John Parry (Mormon) (1789–1868), early Welsh convert to Mormonism and first conductor of the Mormon Tabernacle Choir
*John Orlando Parry (1810–1879), Welsh singer-pianist and comedian, and son of John Parry (Bardd Alaw)
* John Parry, member of Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band
*John Parry (1518-1584), MP for Carmarthen Boroughs (UK Parliament constituency)
*John Parry (1724–1797), Welsh Member of Parliament for Caernarvonshire 1780–90
*John Parry (American football official) (born 1965), National Football League game official from 2000 to 2018
*John Parry (editor) (1812–1817) Welsh editor of the Encyclopaedia Cambrensis

The Encyclopaedia Cambrensis or Y Gwyddoniadur Cymreig  was the most ambitious encyclopedia in the Welsh language. It was published in ten volumes between 1854 and 1879 by Thomas Gee on his press in the town of Denbigh, Gwasg Gee. The general editor was John Parry, Gee's brother in-law and lecturer at the College of Bala.PARRY , JOHN at the Dictionary of Welsh Biography It remains the largest paper publication in Welsh today.
